Hmmm, I might be able to trump you Vanamonde. Pong when it was table-top coin-operated arcade games and only available in bars.

It might have been a space invaders game on the BBC Micro, or one of a number of ZX Spectrum games - there was a fruit machine one, and a flying side-on level-based game called Helichopper, which had the all time greatest level name: "Soft Solid Tank Attack", featuring bouncing rubbery tanks.
Duck Hunt or Super Mario. (or a bunch of other NES games)

Sonic the Hedgehog on a Sega Megadrive (Genesis).

For as far back as I can remember, I always thought of Donkey Kong Country as my first game, I was only a measly three years old when I started I think, still play it whenever I see it too. Haven't finished it though
My Dad told me we had a Commodore 64 (I think that was the right one) when I was very young, but the first game I can actually remember is Legend of Zelda on the NES.
Super Mario Bros. The original. At a sit-down arcade cabinet in a tiny independent burger place that shut down 25 years ago.
Grew up with my brother's copy of Sonic the Hedgehog on the Genesis. Never was a Nintendo guy, but I did eventually end up getting a Gameboy Advance

Hard to remember exactly which. It was an Atari 2600 game, and was probably either Pitfall, Haunted House, or Air-Sea Battle (though the cart I had was named Target Fun, the Sears variant). Maybe Night Driver but I don't think that was the first I went for.

Star Wars, the arcade one with the wireframe action. God I dumped lots of quarters into that thing years before I got my own Nintendo in '86. So its somewhere between '83 and '86, which means somewhere between 5 and 8 yrs old.
